intro: Medicago tribuloides var. cosyrensis, commonly known as the Cosyrenian goatweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, trifoliate leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical structure supports its role as a forage plant for livestock in arid environments.
